pr_title: Stop polling bucket when finished downloading demo data

timeline.message:
Stop polling bucket when finished downloading demo data

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText:
If the following scenarios are handled we should have asserts for them too
-Null type
-Negative values
-Out of range values
-Non integer chars
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: There was already a null check. Added the other checks.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: We should also guard against negative  and out of range numbers
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Added check for negative. No need to check upper range as Long.MAX_VALUE already checked by Long.valueOf
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.message:
Check for invalid EntityId values

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

Check for invalid EntityId values

Signed-off-by: Steven Sheehy <steven.sheehy@hedera.com>

timeline.author: apeksharma
apeksharma

replies.bodyText: Because Lombok annotations would create a static logger and all log entries would appear as Downloader instead of the sub-class.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText:
For signature metrics, recording node as dimension is indeed useful for filtering later. We can store full "0.0.X" as the tag value.
Individual realm, shard and num as dimensions don't seem useful.
timeline.author: apeksharma

replies.bodyText:
I disagree. Full node="0.0.X" does not seem useful and my current approach can satisfy the same query with node=X. Admittedly, for either approach the realm and shard are currently not useful since they're always zero. But once we do have more than one realm or shard my approach will allow us to inspect metrics from those realms and shards separately that having a single key would not give you.
Also, once we go permissionless we will have to remove node since it will blow up the cardinality. We should be able to keep shard and realm. Separating them prepares us for that eventuality.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
True, breaking down into root dimensions gives more flexibility. It's just that for signatures, "root concept" is a node, and thus it seems that any logical conclusion of data points for signatures would be at that abstraction.
Since we'll only have 39 at any point, am not worried about cardinality.
I believe single dimension would have been enough, but am fine with current approach.
replies.author: apeksharma
